edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_3

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_3.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a game engine, which works with MemoryUI by returning responses to the requests from the user interface.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameEngine()
      This is the default constructor for the class, which assigns 0 to moveCount and creates the Grid.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String checkMatch(int pick1, int pick2)
      This method takes two inputs from the user, which are integers that represents a face-down Card in the Grid and compare them by checking symbol values and nullifying them if they're equal.
      boolean gameIsRunning()
      This method checks every Card in the Grid every turn, which keeps the game running if at least one Card isn't null.
      Grid getGrid()
      This method responds to the MemoryUI with by giving it grid for purposes of displaying the Grid to the screen.
      int getMoveCount()
      This method responds to the MemoryUI with the value of moveCount for purposes of displaying it to the screen.
      void nextMove()
      This moves increments moveCount as a representation of the next turn.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine()
        This is the default constructor for the class, which assigns 0 to moveCount and creates the Grid.

    • Method Detail

      • nextMove

        public void nextMove()
        This moves increments moveCount as a representation of the next turn.

      • getMoveCount

        public int getMoveCount()
        This method responds to the MemoryUI with the value of moveCount for purposes of displaying it to the screen.
        Returns:
        The value of moveCount.

      • getGrid

        public Grid getGrid()
        This method responds to the MemoryUI with by giving it grid for purposes of displaying the Grid to the screen.
        Returns:
        The grid to display to the screen.

      • checkMatch

        public java.lang.String checkMatch(int pick1,
                                   int pick2)
        This method takes two inputs from the user, which are integers that represents a face-down Card in the Grid and compare them by checking symbol values and nullifying them if they're equal.
        Parameters:
        pick1 - The first Card the user picks.
        pick2 - The second Card the user picks.
        Returns:
        The symbol matched or an empty string if no match found.

      • gameIsRunning

        public boolean gameIsRunning()
        This method checks every Card in the Grid every turn, which keeps the game running if at least one Card isn't null.
        Returns:
        State of whether at least one Card isn't null.
